Moovit is one app for all your urban mobility and transit rides. 

Transportation is an integral part of urban living. Whether you ride the train, subway, bus, light rail, ferry or metro, use dockless scooters, bikes, ride-sharing like Uber or Lyft, getting the best urban mobility information is critical. Enter Moovit! Moovit provides riders with a one-stop-shop journey experience to help them get from point A to B in the easiest and most efficient way. Get train and bus times, maps, and real-time arrival information with ease so that you can plan your trip with confidence. Pay and validate your rides. Moovit is your personal assistant for all your transit rides! 

► Real-time arrivals. View real-time arrival information, which is taken directly from GPS devices positioned on buses and trains. Avoid wasting time guessing train times or bus times.

► Digital payment. Purchase bus & train tickets and validate your digital pass with a tap (select cities). 

► Real time alerts. Know about issues ahead of time by receiving service alerts such as emergency or unexpected disruptions, delays, traffic jams, new construction, and more so that you can plan ahead if your bus time or train time changed.

Map, Track, Sync and Share Your Trek From Anywhere

For adventure seekers, explorers and outdoor enthusiasts, the Garmin Explore ecosystem offers a complete mobile navigation solution that  — when paired with a compatible Garmin device¹ — lets you map, track and navigate your trek from anywhere with unlimited cloud storage.

Garmin Explore provides basic trip planning or viewing of maps you’ve preloaded on your device. Or you can use the mobile app to pair your smart device via BLUETOOTH®² technology with a compatible Garmin GPS device, so you can do and see even more.

Access Online Connectivity 

Garmin Explore provides free online access to a wide range of additional capabilities. For example, you can download detailed topographic maps, color aerial imagery and other navigation aids directly to your mobile device. The maps and navigation data loaded onto your device can be used anywhere, anytime — even when you’re out beyond the reach of cellphone towers or internet connections.

Manage Your Collections, Tracks and Routes

Review and edit your waypoints, tracks, routes and activities in your library. Add them to a collection to keep all the recorded data from a certain trip together in one place. For example, if you’re taking a long trip, you can plan different waypoints, tracks and routes for each day of the trip and combine them into one collection.

Your Mobile Cloud Connection

The Garmin Explore app will send and store the waypoints, planned routes, GPS tracks and Garmin activities you've recorded in the cloud, allowing you to access and use that data on the Garmin Explore web site to plan or review your adventures. You can also sync your cloud-stored data with a compatible Garmin device. A Garmin account is needed to store your data in the cloud. Your activities (e.g., runs, walks, hikes, etc.) include data such as distance, pace, activity time, location, etc. that were recorded by your device.

More Off-grid Capability with inReach® Technology

Use Garmin Explore with your inReach enabled devices, such as the GPSMAP® 66i navigator and satellite communicator, to turn your mobile device into a true off-the-grid satellite companion. In an emergency, you can trigger an interactive SOS to the GEOS 24/7 emergency response team. Two-way messaging and LiveTrack location tracking via the 100% global Iridium® satellite network let you stay in contact globally. The Garmin Explore app allows you to access your phone’s contact list for easier messaging and sharing when connected.

What You Get with Garmin Explore

• Unlimited map downloads; access topographic maps, USGS quad sheets and more
• Aerial imagery
• Waypoints, tracking and route navigation
• High-detail GPS trip logging and location sharing
• Unlimited cloud storage of routes, waypoints, tracks, and activities
• Online trip planning

VGN Fahrplan & Tickets ist die mobile Fahrplanauskunft des Verkehrsverbundes Großraum Nürnberg (VGN). Ob Sie mit S-Bahn, R-Bahn, U-Bahn, Tram oder Bus im Verbundgebiet unterwegs sind – VGN Fahrplan & Tickets ist Ihr stets verfügbarer Begleiter. Schnell und unkompliziert erhalten Sie Verbindungsauskünfte, aktuelle Abfahrtszeiten und sehen, auf welchem Gleis Ihr Zug abfährt. Dank Echtzeitinformationen bleiben Sie auch bei kurzfristigen Änderungen oder Störungen stets auf dem Laufenden. Detaillierte Karten und Netzpläne sind ebenfalls verfügbar, sowie Hinweise und Benachrichtigungen zu Fahrplanänderungen. Kaufen Sie schnell und bequem ausgewählte VGN-Tickets - und wenn Sie möchten - gleich direkt aus der Verbindungsauskunft. Übrigens, in Nürnberg wird inzwischen jeder vierte Einzelfahrschein über diese App erworben.

Geben Sie für Start und Ziel eine Haltestelle, eine Adresse, einen wichtigen Punkt an, verwenden Sie Ihre aktuelle Position oder wählen Sie einen Kontakt (optional), und Sie erhalten alle wichtigen Informationen für die nächsten Verbindungen. Teilen Sie Ihre Verbindung ganz einfach mit Freunden oder speichern Sie sie im Kalender.

Funktionen
- Live Auskunft mit Echtzeitdaten
- Verbindungen von Haustür zu Haustür
- Abfahrten einer beliebigen Haltestelle 
- Preis- und Tarifinformationen zu jeder Verbindung
- Ticketkauf
- Detaillierte Karten und Netzpläne
- Aktuelle Informationen zu Fahrplanänderungen
- Einstellbare Benachrichtigung bei Störungen


Sie haben die Möglichkeit, der App in den Einstellungen den Zugriff auf Ihre Kontakte zu erlauben, um damit möglichst einfach die dort hinterlegten Adressen als Start oder Ziel zu verwenden. Bei Auswahl eines Kontakts wird nur die ausgewählte Adresse an das Auskunftssystem des VGN gesendet. Unsere Fahrplanauskunft kann dabei nicht unterscheiden, ob die Adresse aus den Kontakten stammt oder manuell eingegeben wurde. Deshalb benötigt die App unter anderem die Berechtigung für Kontakte.

Darüber hinaus ist zur Nutzung aller Funktionen eine Internetverbindung sowie die Aktivierung der Ortungsfunktion erforderlich.

summary.label:
The LinzMobil app by LINZ AG LINIEN for tickets, routes and mobility.
LinzMobil – My app for my journeys!

The LinzMobil app provides
- information about LINZ AG LINIEN departures in real time,
- route recommendations by the Austrian traffic information (‘VAO’),
- LINZ AG LINIEN tickets directly and quickly on your smartphone any time as well as
- information about mobility partners like ‘tim’ (e-)carsharing, ‘AST’ ride share taxi services, conventional taxi and SIXT car rental –
all in one app!
Registration is only required for purchasing personalised tickets.
The LinzMobil app by LINZ AG LINIEN can be downloaded for free.

° Features:
Departures & interactive map:
The departure screen including a map of your surroundings lists the next departures from stops in your area or any requested stop. You can select either public means of transport or other mobility services like ‘AST’ (ride share taxi services) or ‘tim’ (e-)carsharing.

° Routing:
Planning your journeys with LinzMobil is easy: simply type in a destination or mark a location on the map. With active GPS your current location is automatically assumed as the starting point of your journey. In case this is not your desired place of departure, you can type in any other address or stop. Your current location, any stop or any address can be selected as starting point or destination.

° Tickets:
- The following tickets are available via the LinzMobil app:
- 1-hour-Ticket (valid for 60 minutes)
- 24-hour ticket (standard fare ‘Vollpreis’, reduced fare ‘ermäßigt’, youth fare ‘Jugend’)
- Kurzstrecke (short-distance journey)
- Langstrecke (long-distance journey: standard fare ‘Vollpreis’, reduced fare ‘ermäßigt’, youth fare ‘Jugend’)
- Wochenkarte (weekly pass)
- Monatskarte (monthly pass)
- Aktivpass-Monatskarte Linz (monthly pass for ‘Aktivpass’ holders)
- Senioren-Monatskarten (senior citizens monthly pass for Linz, Leonding, Puchenau, Steyregg, Wilhering)
- Pöstlingbergbahn Berg- oder Talfahrt (single uphill OR downhill ticket: standard fare ‘Erwachsene’ or reduced fare ‘ermäßigt’)
- Pöstlingbergbahn Berg- und Talfahrt (uphill AND downhill journey: standard fare ‘Erwachsene’ or reduced fare ‘ermäßigt’)
- Erlebnisticket (combined ticket: standard fare ‘Erwachsene’ or reduced fare ‘ermäßigt’)

Registration is required for purchasing tickets.

° Payment methods:
Credit card (MasterCard, VISA, American Express, Diners Club)
Apple Pay or
PayPal

° Mobility services
In addition to the LINZ AG LINIEN public transport services, LinzMobil provides further mobility services like information about ‘tim’ (e-)carsharing, ‘AST’ (ride share taxi services), conventional taxi services, SIXT car rental and electric vehicle charging stations.
‘AST’ and ‘tim’ locations are marked as POI on the map. They include further information and can be selected as starting point or destination of your journey.

° Favourites
You can create a list of personal favourites by marking stops or addresses with a star. These favourite locations will be displayed at the top of your list of suggestions when typing in a starting point or destination.

° Settings & filters:
By selecting filters (modal choice) and determining personal settings (e.g. number of transfers or sorting the route recommendations by arrival, departure, duration etc.), you can organise and request your information and routes according to your preferences. This will speed up your search processes.

More features are being planned! For further questions please contact linien@linzag.at! We appreciate your feedback.
Future. All aboard!
